nodes.text: The gondar was a species of tusked creatures. Gondar pits were said to smell bad, and Triv Pothman compared poor-tasting coffee to the sweat of a gondar while onboard the Eye of Palpatine in the year 12 ABY. Their tusks were used in armor, such as Tantel armor, or as decorations. While using the alias of Tamtel Skreej when rescuing a carbonite frozen Han Solo from Jabba's Palace in 4 ABY, Lando Calrissian was wearing a set of Tantel armor, of which the helmet had curved, white gondar tusks protruding from it.

Gondar tusks first appeared as part of Billy Dee Williams' Tamtel Skreej costume, which was designed by Nilo Rodis-Jamero and Aggie Guerard Rodgers for Star Wars: Episode VI Return of the Jedi The movie was released in 1983, but the tusks were not identified as belonging to a gondar until Taster's Choice: The Tale of Jabba's Chef, which was published in Tales from Jabba's Palace in January 1996. Gondar tusks also appeared in Star Wars Galaxies, as part of a wearable version of Tantel armor, as well as an in-game painting, 30th Anniversary Bash, given out to players who attended Nym's Anniversary Bash, which lasted from May 23 to June 25, 2007. The gondar species itself was mentioned in Children of the Jedi, The New Rebellion, and The Complete Star Wars Encyclopedia, but their sentience was not detailed.
